name: Way of Mercy
description: Monks of the Way of Mercy are wandering physicians who use their understanding of life force to aid the needy and bring a swift end to those beyond help. They might be gentle healers or masked bringers of grim mercies, often wearing robes and masks.

implements_of_mercy.description: Gain proficiency in Insight, Medicine, and with the herbalism kit. Also, you receive a special mask.

effect.mask: You determine the mask's appearance or roll on the Merciful Mask table.

hands_of_healing.effect: As an action, spend 1 ki point to restore hit points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature without spending a ki point when using Flurry of Blows.

hands_of_harm.description: Use your ki to inflict necrotic damage.
hands_of_harm.effect: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 1 ki point to deal extra necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. This can be used only once per turn.

physicians_touch.description: Administer greater cures or cause harm with your touch.
physicians_touch.effect: When using Hands of Healing, you can also end one disease or one of the following conditions: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned. When using Hands of Harm, you can inflict the poisoned condition until the end of your next turn.

flurry_of_healing_and_harm.description: Replace each unarmed strike in Flurry of Blows with Hands of Healing, or use Hands of Harm without spending ki points.
flurry_of_healing_and_harm.effect: When using Flurry of Blows, replace each unarmed strike with Hands of Healing without spending ki points. Hands of Harm can be used with a Flurry of Blows strike without spending ki points, but only once per turn.

hand_of_ultimate_mercy.description: Return a creature to life as an ultimate mercy.
hand_of_ultimate_mercy.effect: As an action, touch the corpse of a creature that died within the past 24 hours and expend 5 ki points. The creature returns to life with hit points equal to 4d10 + your Wisdom modifier, and any conditions it died with (blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned) are removed. This feature can be used once per long rest.
